QuestionStem: Complete the paragraph to describe the plant cell as a system.

options.PreQuestion: In this plant cell, the system boundary is the
. An example of a system process is

CorrectFeedback: In the system of this plant cell, the nutrients are the inputs, and the wastes are the outputs. Because the cell wall is outside the cell membrane, the cell wall is the system boundary. A system process of a plant cell is photosynthesis, the process by which plants make food.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: A system input is something that is put into a system that produces an output, and a system output is something that is produced by a system input. A system boundary marks off the extent of a system, and a system process is an operation of a system undertaken in order to produce something or to achieve a particular result.
IncorrectFeedback: A system input is something that is put into a system that produces an output, and a system output is something that is produced by a system input. A system boundary marks off the extent of a system, and a system process is an operation of a system undertaken in order to produce something or to achieve a particular result.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: In the system of this plant cell, the nutrients are the inputs, and the wastes are the outputs. Because the cell wall is outside the cell membrane, the cell wall is the system boundary. A system process of a plant cell is photosynthesis, the process by which plants make food.
